text: A working class neighborhood in the heart of Far Rockaway Broken down stoops adorn each home while CAR ALARMS and SHOUTING can be heard in the distance as the hard SQUABBL LOCALS go about their morning routine.

LUKE MURRAY, 21, lies in bed, dead to the world, even as late morning sun fights its way in. Suddenly his SIDEKICK vibrates to life. He slowly starts to stir as the sidekick works its way of the desk and CRASHES to the floor with a THUNK. That does the trick... Luke starts to come to. On the surface he appears good-looking, even handsome; but behin his intense, blue eyes one can see the residual grit of bygone pain. He sits up and blearily rubs away the sleep when he notic his alarm clock. Adrenaline hits him in waves. He leaps out of the sheets and slings on a pair of jeans, racing out of the room...

++. pulling on a shirt as he goes but in his haste he missteps and tumbles forward, crashing downwards, coming stop on the landing below. He springs up and makes a b-line for the door when he sto dead in his tracks, remembering. He turns back around... INT. LUKE’S ROOM ++. and tears through his sock drawer until he finds what he’s looking for. It’s a small jewelry box. He quickly pockets it and takes off...
«+. weaving through the HUSTLE and BUSTLE of the morning commute as... °

Hey, hold that door... Luke races towards the subway car but the cynical New Yor don't lift a finger as the departure BELLS RING out and t doors slowly close... «+. but Luke quickly slings his bag forward, wedging the doors open.
Hey... : The CONDUCTOR leans out.

Come on, help me out. I’m gonna be late for class. The conductor shakes his head... the doors jerk back and forth... trying to open as Luke pulls free his bag. He go to enter when suddenly the doors slam shut.

Hey! The conductor grins as the train begins to pull away. LUKE (CONT’D) You gotta be kiddin’ me! Luke pounds on the window in disbelief, futilely racing a the train, making his way to the end of the platform when suddenly -- -- a WOMAN SCREAMS. Luke spins around and sees a THIEF ri the woman’s purse away. She’s thrown off balance and topp backwards, crashing onto the tracks below. Stunned COMMUTERS stand there frozen as an express train ROARS towards the woman -- its HORN BLARING. Panic fills the air as Luke reacts without thinking. He races over, jumps down and moves to pick the woman up as.

++. The CONDUCTOR yanks hard on the emergency BRAKE -- th SCREECHING HOWL OF METAL ON METAL -- as SPARKS FLY and SM BILLOWS -- but the train is moving too fast --  3. -- Luke sees it BARRELING towards him. ONLOOKERS hold the breath, others turn away as -- -- Luke makes a split second decision. He pushes the woma into a foot-deep trough between the tracks, covering her his body as -- -- The SCREECHING TRAIN runs over them. The crowd looks o aghast as the train slowly comes to a halt.
Luke looks up at the inch of clearance above his head, it the difference between life and death.
Holy shit... To the CROWD’S surprise, Luke rolls out from underneath t train with the woman. They all CHEER.
Luke, haggard and dirtied, rushes toward a lecture hall w the doors swing open and STUDENTS file out.
Damn... SOPHIA, a good-looking brunette, approaches him.
What happened to you?
It’s a long story. PROFESSOR SELBY, 50's, bookish, spots Luke.
You out did: yourself today, Mr. Murray. Instead of just being late you missed class all together.
I’m sorry professor but I was only late because --
Don’t ruin an apology with an excuse. Get here on time. That shouldn’t be hard for someone as smart as you.
But professor I -- Professor Selby waves it off as he walks away.
-- just saved someone’s life.
Luke and Sophia make their way along.
Oh my god that’s crazy. Thank god you’re alright.
It was no big deal. Honestly. She smiles, that’s what she loves about him.
I still think you should tell Professor Selby what happened.
Nah, it’s not worth it... But listen, uh... He hesitates.
What?
About tonight, I can’t make it.
What? Why?
I got called into work. Disappointment fills her face.
Luke...
I'll make it up to you, I swear. We'll do something tomorrow night. But I want you to have this. He pulls out the small jewelry box.
Happy anniversary. She opens it and finds a GOLDEN CLADDAGH RING.
Oh my God, it’s beautiful.
It was my mother’s. She would have worn it until I met the girl I would marry. He slips the ring onto her finger. LUKE (CONT’D) We’re officially engaged to be engaged. She gives him a kiss.
The organized chaos of the SOUTH STREET SEAPORT begins it daily grind. Forklifts whiz back and forth and truckers upload their cargo as a FOREMAN makes his way over to Luk

Hey, Joe College... when you finish those orders I’m gonna need your help with the grouper. Luke nods as he packs huge MACKERELS into heavy crates of ice. It’s bone-numbing work but it pays well and he can d it at night.
Luke crashes onto the seat and leans against the window, eyeing the bright lights of the metropolis as...
-.. they begin to fade away and the train makes its way t the darkness that is Queens.

Luke hustles down the platform stairs and makes his way..  EXT. ST. MICHAEL’S CEMETERY - CONT. ++. to an OLD GOTHIC CEMETERY, knowingly weaving through various. tombstones, before stopping in front of a grave. stares at it for a long moment.

Hey Ma, I just wanted you to know that I gave it to her. She loved it. You should have seen her. (beat ) Well, I gotta get going. I love ya. Luke goes to take off when he notices some unsavory characters up ahead. Even in the evening twilight Luke ca make out the SPARK of their CRACK PIPES. He quickly bangs a hard right, trying to avoid them when something gives him pause... He stops, looks all around, surprised to find his heart racing... He shakes his head, dismissing his fear when... +--+ he notices a fallen oak tree. It has pulverized an ornate HEADSTONE, laying waste to its centuries old morta He moves in closer to get a better look when he sees an OMINOUS BLACK. BOOK amongst the rubble. He picks it up, wiping debris from its cover. INSERT COVER: “DEATH NOTE” He almost laughs at the title as he flips it open and rea “THE HUMAN WHOSE NAME IS WRITTEN IN THIS BOOK SHALL DIE.” Luke grins at the ridiculousness of it all. He goes to th it away but-there’s something about the book that gives h pause.
Suddenly his sidekick RINGS. LUKE (CONT’D) (into sidekick) Hey, what's up?
SARAH, 12, Luke's rebellious little sister, checks the fridge. .
(into phone) Nothing. I’m just starving over here.
Where’s Dad?
He’s not home yet.
Alright, hang tight. I’11 be there in a sec. INT. LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN - LUKE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Luke hurriedly enters as Sarah bangs out a text.
Hey, you feel like having a grilled cheese sandwich?
Only if you’re makin’ it. He throws down his stuff and gets busy at the stove.
Did you do your homework?
Nope.
Why not?
Because I’m gonna do it in study hall. He shoots her a look. SARAH (CONT’D) What? Everyone in my class is so stupid. It’s a joke.
Do me a favor and do it now anyway. Just then POLICE CAPTAIN JOHN MURRAY, an incisive, no- nonsense type, enters, weary from a long shift.
Hey guys. Sorry, I’m late.
Hey Pop. Hey, Daddy. He blearily flips through a stack of.mail as he joins Luk
Hey, your LSAT score came in.
Yeah, I know they e-mailed it to me last week.
Last week? Why didn’t you say anything? Luke just shrugs as Capt. Murray opens the letter, expect the worse.
Oh my God! Excitement flushes through him as he bear hugs Luke.
Come on, Dad. Take it easy.
Take it easy? You sly son of a gun. Do you know what this means?
It's not a big deal. Honestly.
You’re something else, you really are Luke. (to Sarah) Do you know what your brother just did?
No, but I got a feeling you're gonna tell me.
He just scored in the ninety-eighth percentile on his LSAT. How about that?!

You’re such a dork, Luke. He playfully smacks her as he makes his way up the stairs INT. LUKE’S ROOM +--+. and flips on the tv all the while rummaging through bookbag. He notices the Death Note. He can’t help but pag through it, stopping on the LAWS OF THE DEATH NOTE PAGE.

(reading) Rejoice and fear, your lives rest in my hands... Luke grins as he reads the rules when suddenly the newsca grabs his attention. ON TV: OFFICERS, guns drawn, stand poised behind their CRUISERS as a REPORTER files an update.
We're live here on Commercial Avenue where Mark Tocher, a convicted sex offender, is believed to have taken an entire family hostage -- GUNSHOTS RING out from the besieged home.

Oh my god! The Reporter and CAMERA MAN rush for cover as the camera zooms in on the PERPETRATOR, BLASTING away from a second story window, all the while shielding himself behind a terrified YOUNG MOTHER.

Scumbag... Luke looks at the Death Note, twirling his pen as the per name flashes on screen. On a whim, almost as a joke, Luke writes MARK TOCHER in t book before tossing it into a waste basket and moving to bathroom. -

Luke splashes water on his face and... INT. LUKE’S ROOM ++. re-enters brushing his teeth. He glances at the newscast. The COPS can’t return fire and stand there helplessly. LUKE shakes his head and returns to the bathroom when...
The terrified FAMILY comes rushing out from the house.  10.
Uh... we’re not sure what’s going on... OFFICERS race to the hostages’ aid as the reporter hurrie over to the Young Mother.
Excuse me ma’am, can you tell us what happened?
It was a miracle. The MOTHER is hysterical, fighting back tears as OFFICERS off the Reporter and whisk her away.
Well, uh, we’re not exactly sure what just happened but it looks like the hostages are okay... Again, Mark Tocher... TOCHER’s mug shot fills the screen as LUKE re-enters, oblivious.
«+. known felon and sex offender... Luke glances over; it looks like more of the same. He shu off the tv and crashes into bed, exhausted.
Sophia glances at her watch as Luke hurriedly joins her.
Hey, sorry I’m late.
You know what I’m gonna do, Luke, I’m gonna buy you a watch.
I don’t need a watch. I use this. He shows her his sidekick.
That’s the problem, you can’t set your cell phone ahead. She rips it from his hands and messes with the settings.  ll.
What are you talkin’ about?
I set my watch ahead and now I’m never late.
(grins) That won't work for me.
How do you know?
‘Cause I know.
Trust me. All you gotta do is set it seven minutes ahead.
Why seven?

Because five doesn’t give you enough time and ten is too easy to figure out. That’s why seven is just right. It’s enough time to do what you gotta do but too much of a hassle to figure out... She grows frustrated with the sidekick and hands it back, leaving a message on the display. INSERT: :-)
(smiles) Right, whatever.
Trust me. It works. He doesn’t buy it.
Eight forty-three (as if saying quickly) what time is it?
Eight thirty-six. She realizes he’s right.
One o three.  12.
Twelve fifty-six.
Two eleven. Two o four.
Five fifty-five. Five forty-eight. She grins. It’s-no use. He rattles off the answers almost as fast as she asks.
Well with normal people it works.
I'll take your word for it. They share a smile as they make their way along when suddenly...

That thing in Bay Ridge last night, I didn’t know the guy died.

Yeah, he was gonna kill that whole family. A train comes to a roaring stop on the track next to them SOPHIA (CONT’D) Luke, come on, let’s go. Hierocles said, “Law and justice are not always the same. And when they aren’t, destroying the law may be the first step toward changing it...” Luke only half listens as he finds what he’s looking for, it’s an article on the Bay Ridge incident. Luke throws down his bookbag and moves to his desk when.. notices the Death Note in the waste basket. He pulls it out, flips it open and looks at the name he w -- Mark Tocher. Rule - The Death Note will not take effect unless the writer has the person’s face in their mind when writing their name. Therefore, people sharing the same name will not be affected.
Luke shakes his head but the truth is, something urges hi onwards. He turns on the television and flips to COURT TV

Luke watches as the suspect’s vehicle dangerously weaves and out of traffic before losing control and smashing int several cars. NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) Oh my god, this is terrible! The perp, Stone, jumps out and makes a run for it as the frantically give chase. NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) The suspect simply refuses to give up... Stone races to a twenty foot overpass and to the cops’ amazement... jumps down, rolls to absorb the impact and r away with only a slight limp. The cops are forced to double back. Stone draws his gun, car jacks a red Mustang and begins t race away when suddenly the Mustang swerves off the road SMASHES into a fire hydrant.

No way... Just then the doorbell RINGS, startling him. INT. / EXT. LIVING ROOM - CONT. Luke moves to the door and is taken aback when he sees a POLICE OFFICER standing outside. He slowly opens the door

MURRAY (CONT’D) Come on, pack that stuff up and get out of here.

I promise... on my mother’s soul.
Good because if you don’t and you tell someone about our little conversation I’m gonna come looking for you... and we both know what that means.  30.
